 PREV   NEXT FRAMES    NO FRAMES    

This document is the description of the classes and interfaces used in rapla.

See:
          Description

Packages
org.rapla This package contains the classes for initializing a rapla-system.
org.rapla.bootstrap  
org.rapla.client The client package is responsible for initialize the gui and the client-plugins and providing the services for the client application.
org.rapla.components.calendar Contains widgets for date- and time- selection.
org.rapla.components.iolayer The IO layer is an abstraction from the io differences in webstart or desktop mode.
org.rapla.components.layout This package contains additional LayoutManagers.
org.rapla.components.tablesorter  
org.rapla.components.util Some more helpful tools.
org.rapla.components.util.iterator Iterators used by Rapla.
org.rapla.components.util.undo  
org.rapla.components.xmlbundle Components for storing locale-specific resources in xml-files.
org.rapla.entities Contains the interfaces of the persistent entity-objects in rapla.
org.rapla.entities.configuration  
org.rapla.entities.domain The main domain entities of rapla (reservations and resources) are located in this package.
org.rapla.entities.dynamictype  
org.rapla.examples  
org.rapla.facade This package contains the facade, that encapsulate the storage and the entitie package and provides a simple interface for accessing the rapla-system; Study this package to get a good summary of the functionality of Rapla.
org.rapla.framework This package contains the framework, that is responsible for component creation with dependency injection.
org.rapla.framework.logger  
org.rapla.gui This is the base package of the GUI-client.
org.rapla.gui.images  
org.rapla.gui.toolkit  
org.rapla.plugin.mail  
org.rapla.plugin.tableview  
org.rapla.server The server synchronizes and bundles the client requests and maintains a single storage for all its clients.
org.rapla.servletpages Contains the default pages served by the rapla server servlet

 

This document is the description of the classes and interfaces used in rapla.

 Version 1.7RC1

For more information contact the developers mailinglist or take look at the documentation section on our homepage.

See Also:
http://code.google.com/p/rapla, mailinglist
